channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report E-2024040427
item.description:
Report E-2024040427

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: ASHLAND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 11, 2024, at 0844 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Ashland, Virginia regarding the release of approximately (3) gallons of BLUESKIN LVC ADHESIVE (UN1133, 3, II) from (1) 5-gallon poly drum due to being punctured by a forklift. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was contained to a 5ft x 8ft area on the trailer floor and cardboard. Contractors were able to clean the release with a multi-purpose remover, absorbents, and the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (1) 55-gallon DM and was taken offsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040387
item.description:
Report E-2024040387

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: PORTSMOUTH
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 8, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was damaged due to a bad weld and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized an 85-gallon open top drum to overpack and contain the damaged 55-gallon drum. ES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer interior and worked them in with hand tools. Crews utilized absorbent pads to wipe the released product off the pallet. All UN1993-impacted material was collected and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040455
item.description:
Report E-2024040455

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 15000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While pulling through the pumps to get to the drops the driver struck the bolster in front of the drops. The strike sheered off the loading heads for compartment three and five. This resulted in a diesel spill of approximately 35-40 gallons. CDG managed the spill cleanup. Product reached 2 storm drains. FD was on scene and reported the spill to the local VADEQ (VDEM-2024-03-02-0008).

item.title: Report X-2024040660
item.description:
Report X-2024040660

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: SOUTH CHESTERFIELD
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the trailer leaking and qa was immediately notified of the leakage. Package was then placed into a salvage drum to be inspected. DescribePack: Package was found leaking from the inside. Box was soaking in corrosive cleaner due to the loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was then placed into a salvage drum to be inspected.

item.title: Report X-2024040710
item.description:
Report X-2024040710

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: ROANOKE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Mechanical employee conducting an outbound inspection noticed the strong smell of sulfur in the area of SHPX 209817. He left the area and reported it. NS Haz Mat and contractor responded checked the car and found high S02 reading around the manway area. We could also hear a hissing from the manway. Tightening manway bolts did not stop leak. Manway was opened and found to have two (2) gaskets in place, one flat in the manway cover and one mounted on the manway nozzle. Both gaskets were removed and replaced with new one. Manway was secured and tested with meter. No detect. Car was release for transportation.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: HAZMAT WAS FOUND BY A PACKAGE HANDLER UNLOADING A TRUCK. HAZMAT WAS GIVEN TO OPS MANAGER AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE UNDER THE HOOD. THE HOOD WAS TURNED ON. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS CRACKED DUE TO THE PACKAGING OF THE MATERIAL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT WAS PLACED UNDER THE HOOD
